TCA/Acetone and Chloroform : Methanol : Isopropanol (2:1:1) method for Plasma Protein Purification.

 

 

1.     200µl of plasma was taken in an Eppendorf tube and 1ml of Chloroform: Methanol: Isopropanol (500 µl: 250 µl: 250 µl) was added and kept it for 15 minutes.

Mix the solution).

 

2.     The tube was centrifuged at 12000 rcf for 10 minutes at 4°C and the supernatant was discarded.

 

3.     Then, 800 µl TCA/Acetone (50%) was added and incubated overnight at -20°C.

 

4.     The tube was centrifuged at 12000 rcf for 10 minutes at 4°C and the supernatant was discarded.

 

5.      Add 1ml of Isopropanol in each Eppendorf tube and centrifuged at 12000 rcf for 10 minutes at 4°C and the supernatant was discarded.

 

6.     Let the Eppendorf tubes (protein)
Add 200µl of sample buffer for protein (SBP) in each tube and let the protein

Dissolve in it completely.

 

8.     Purified protein was estimated by Bradford assay.

 

9.     Then the purified protein samples of leprosy and healthy individual were checked in 12% SDS-PAGE.
10.  The purified protein bands were observed by staining and de-staining procedure.
11.  Clear gel images were observed through gel documentation system.
